document.masterDocTitle: The stigmaeid mites (Acari: Stigmaeidae) of Kelkit Valley (Turkey)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The stigmaeid mites (Acari: Stigmaeidae) of Kelkit Valley (Turkey)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Ledermuelleria lacuna
Summers, 1957 b
: 53
;
Summers & Price, 1961
: 378
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Female (
Figures 10
, 11 ) Length of body 367 ( 350–383 ), width 225 ( 220–235 ).

Dorsum . Dorsal shields faintly punctated. Oval dimples evident laterally. Fossettes on dorsal shields as illustrated. Propodosomal shield with four pairs of setae and one pair of eyes located between setae ve and sci . Hysterosomal shield with six pairs of setae. Propodosomal and hysterosomal shields with marginal incision laterally. Propodosomal shield with two marginal incisions between setae sci and sce . Hysterosomal shield with marginal incision above setae e 2 . This marginal incision not seen in some specimens. Suranal shield tucked under body, with two pairs of setae. Dorsal setae stout, rod like, with axial core and with a very thin hyaline sheath. Dimensions of setae as follows:
vi 26
( 23–30 ); ve 40 ( 35–45 ); sci 37 ( 33–40 ); sce 40 ( 37–45 ); c 1 25 ( 23–30 ); c 2 17 ( 13–20 ); d 1 23 ( 20–27 ); d 2 43 ( 40–48 ); e 1 40 ( 35–45 ); e 2 43 ( 40–48 ); f 1 50 ( 47–55 ); h 1 35 ( 30–37 ); h 2 25 ( 18–27 ). Distances between setae: vi-vi 38 ( 27–45 ); ve-ve 80 ( 70–87 ); vi-ve 35 ( 30–40 ); sci-sci 143 ( 135–150 ); ve-sci 43 ( 35–50 ); scesce 200 ( 180–220 ); sci-sce 43 ( 40–47 ); c 1 -c 1 157 ( 150–163 ); c 1 -d 1 90 ( 85–95 ); d 1 -d 1 143 ( 135–150 ); d 2 -d 2 210 ( 205– 215 ); d 1 -d 2 63 ( 57–67 ); e 2 -e 2 175 ( 168–183 ); d 1 -e 1 30 ( 25–35 ); e 1 -e 1 130 ( 127–133 ); e 1 -e 2 68 ( 63–70 ); d 1 -e 2 90 ( 83– 95 ); e 2 -d 2 149 ( 140–157 ); f 1 -f 1 83 ( 80–85 ); e 1 -f 1 35 ( 33–40 ); e 2 -f 1 115 ( 110–120 ); h 1 -h 1 28 ( 25–33 ); h 2 -h 2 65 ( 60–73 ); h 1 -h 2 20 ( 18–23 ).

Venter . Humeral regions with major and minor callosities. The callosities finely punctated, not conjunct with margins of dorsal shields. Humeral shields bearing setae c 2 . The patterns on humeral shields similar with dorsal shields. Coxisternal shields completely divided, reticulated and faintly punctated, bearing three pairs of setae. Aggenital shield with three pairs of setae and anogenital covers bearing three pairs of setae. Dimensions of setae as follows: ag 1 = ag 2 = ag 3 8 ( 5–10 ); ps 1 15 ( 13–20 ); ps 2 12 ( 8–15 ); ps 3 13 ( 10–15 ). ps 1 is thicker than other anogenitals.

Legs . Leg I 227 ( 218–240 ), leg II 195 ( 190–200 ), leg III 180 ( 174–195 ), leg IV 215 ( 205–225 ). Chaetotaxy of leg segments as follows: coxae 2 – 2 – 2 – 2 , trochanters 1 – 1–2 – 1 , femora 6 – 5 – 3 – 2 , genua 4 (κ)– 4 (κ)– 1 – 1 , tibiae 7 (ϕ,ϕρ)– 6 (ϕρ)– 6 (ϕρ)– 6 (ϕρ), tarsi 14 (ω)– 10 (ω)– 8 (ω)– 8 (ω). Genua I and II with solenidion κ. All tarsi with solenidion ω.

Gnathosoma .
Chelicera 87 ( 75–93 ), palp 110 ( 95–115 ). Subcapitulum with two pairs of adoral setae distally and two pairs of subcapitular setae proximally. Dimension of setae: m 13 ( 10–15 ); n 18 ( 13–20 ); distances between setae: m-m 21 ( 15–23 ); n-n 23 ( 18–28 ); m-n 12 ( 10–15 ).

Dorsum. Dorsal shields faintly punctated as in female. Propodosomal shield with three pairs of setae. Eyes located between setae ve and sci . Setae sce located on small shields. Propodosomal shield without marginal incision. Hysterosomal shield with five pairs of setae, setae d 2 located on small shields. Hysterosomal shield with marginal incision anterior to setae e 2 . Suranal shield with two pairs of setae. Dorsal body setae as in female. Dimensions of setae as follows:
vi 21
( 20–23 ); ve 35 ( 30–38 ); sci 17 ( 15–18 ); sce 24 ( 23–25 ); c 1 17 ( 15–18 ); c 2 23 ( 20–25 ); d 1 17 ( 15–20 ); d 2 23 ( 20–25 ); e 1 25 ( 23–28 ); e 2 19 ( 18–20 ); f 1 44 ( 43–45 ); h 1 19 ( 18–20 ); h 2 15 ( 15 – 15 ). Distances between setae: vi-vi 26 ( 25–28 ); ve-ve 55 ( 53–58 ); vi-ve 35 ( 30–38 ); sci- sci 113 ( 110–115 ); ve-sci 31 ( 30–33 ); c 1 -c 1 97 ( 95–100 ); c 1 -d 1 55 ( 53–58 ); d 1 -d 1 94 ( 93–95 ); e 2 -e 2 147 ( 145–150 ); d 1 -e 1 64 ( 63–65 ); e 1 -e 1 95 ( 93– 98 ); e 1 -e 2 43 ( 40–45 ); d 1 -e 2 31 ( 30–33 ); f 1 -f 1 55 ( 53–58 ); e 1 -f 1 40 ( 40 – 40 ); e 2 -f 1 74 ( 73–75 ); h 1 -h 1 20 ( 18–23 ); h 2 -h 2 43 ( 40–45 ); h 1 -h 2 12 ( 10–13 ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 10.
Eustigmaeus lacuna
female—A, dorsal view of idiosoma; B, ventral view of idiosoma.

subSubSection.paragraph: Venter . Humeral shields placed laterally, with setae c 2 . Humeral regions with two pairs of callosities. Coxisternal shields completely separated, bearing three pairs of setae. Aggenital shield with three pairs of setae and anogenital covers bearing three pairs of setae.

Legs . Leg I 152 ( 150–153 ), leg II 125 ( 125 – 125 ), leg III 116 ( 115–118 ), leg IV 133 ( 130–135 ). Chaetotaxy of leg segments as follows: coxae 2 – 2 – 2 – 2 , trochanters 1 – 1–2 –0, femora 6 – 5 – 3 – 2 , genua 4 (κ)– 4 (κ)–0–0, tibiae 7 (ϕ,ϕρ)– 6 (ϕρ)– 6 (ϕρ)– 6 (ϕρ), tarsi 12 (ω)– 10 (ω)– 8 (ω)– 8 (ω).

Gnathosoma .
As in female. Chelicera 64 ( 63–65 ), palp 81 ( 80–83 ). Dimension of setae: m 8 ( 8 – 8 ), n 11 ( 10– 12 ).

Male
(
Figure 13
) Length of body 255 , width 140 .

Dorsum. Dorsal shield covered with reticulations. Propodosomal shield with four pairs of setae and one pair of eyes located between setae ve and sci . Propodosomal shield with marginal incision anterior to setae sce. Hysterosomal shield without marginal incision, with six pairs of setae. Suranal shield without reticulate patterns, with two pairs of setae. Dorsal body setae as in female. Dimensions of setae as follows:
vi 30
; ve 30 ; sci 25 ; sce 35 ; c 1 20 ; c 2 38 ; d 1 18 ; d 2 25 ; e 1 15 ; e 2 27 ; f 1 38 ; h 1 13 ; h 2 35 . Distances between setae: vi-vi 18 ; ve-ve 50 ; vi-ve 35 ; sci-sci 63 ; vesci 25 ; sce-sce 120 ; sci-sce 33 ; c 1 -c 1 65 ; c 1 -d 1 60 ; d 1 -d 1 60 ; d 2 -d 2 115 ; d 1 -d 2 40 ; e 2 -e 2 30 ; d 1 -e 1 53 ; d 1 -e 2 35 ; d 2 -e 2 63 ; e 1 -e 1 40 ; e 1 -e 2 30 ; f 1 -f 1 45 ; e 1 -f 1 27 ; e 2 -f 1 33 ; h 1 -h 1 35 ; h 2 -h 2 45 ; h 1 -h 2 15 .

Venter . Humerals with setae c 2 . Coxisternal shields completely separated, bearing three pairs of setae. Aggenital shield with two pairs of setae. Anogenital covers tucked over the body, bearing three pairs of setae.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 11.
Eustigmaeus lacuna
female—A, lateral view of idiosoma; B, leg I; C, leg II; D, leg III; E, leg IV.

subSubSection.paragraph: Legs . Leg I 165 , leg II 143 , leg III 130 , leg IV 150 . Chaetotaxy of leg segments as follows: coxae 2 – 2 – 2 – 2 , trochanters 1 – 1–2 – 1 , femora 6 – 5 – 3 – 2 , genua 4 (κ)– 4 (κ)– 1 – 1 , tibiae 7 (ϕ,ϕρ)– 6 (ϕρ)– 6 (ϕρ)– 6 (ϕρ), tarsi 15 (ω,ω 3 )– 11 (ω,ω 3 )– 9 (ω,ω 3 )– 9 (ω,ω 3 ). All tarsi with two solenidia.

Gnathosoma .
As in female. Chelicera 55 , palp 74 . Dimension of setae m 10 , n 15 ; distances between setae: mm 18 ; n-n 25 ; m-n 10 .

Materials examined. 6 ƤƤ, 2 deutonymph ƤƤ, 1 3 from moist moss from near a brook,
40 ° 17 ' 29 '' N
,
39 ° 35 ' 29 '' E
, 1818 m , Köse Mountain,
14 VII 2009
; ZMAU .

Remarks.
Eustigmaeus lacuna
, a new record for the Turkish fauna, can easily be distinguished by the marginal incisions on the dorsal shields. This species was defined from the deutonymph female by
Summers ( 1957 b)
and then adult female and male were recorded by
Summers and Price ( 1961 )
. The U.S.A. specimens were recorded from litter under Liliaceae and
Salix
sp. and mossy soil (
Summers 1957 b
;
Summers & Price 1961
). The Turkish specimens were collected from moist moss near a brook.

Tarsus IV has seven setae in the adult female according to
Summers & Price ( 1961 )
, but the Turkish specimens’ tarsus IV has eight setae including solenidion ω. In the type specimens, setae sce are the shortest and setae c 2 are almost the same length as setae c 1 (
Summers & Price, 1961
), but in the Turkish specimens c 2 the shortest setae. Despite these differences, we consider the Turkish and U.S.A. specimens to be conspecific.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 12.
Eustigmaeus lacuna
deutonymph female—A, dorsal view of idiosoma; B, ventral view of idiosoma.

others by the hysterosomal shield bearing five pairs
setae e 2) and trochanter III bearing one seta.

Remarks. This species can be distinguished from other known species by the following combination of characters: propodosomal shield pointed anteriorly, eyes and fossettes on dorsal shields present, endopodal shields completely fused and reticulated, and dorsal body setae bushy, shorter than distances between their successive bases, leg femur II bearing five setae. In the specimens collected from Afyonkarahisar and İzmir ( Turkey ) the dorsal setae have a hyaline sheath distally (
Kara 2005
; Akyol 2007 ); however, in our specimens such a structure was not observed. Our specimens exhibit all characters of type specimens.

Remarks. This species resembles
E. anauniensis (Canestrini)
, but it differs from the latter species in the different shape of humeral setae c 2 . Our specimens match other known specimens of
E. erzurumensis
.
